title: TERVYX Protocol v1.0: A Reproducible Governance & Labeling Standard for Health-Information Evidence
description: The TERVYX Protocol (Tiered Evidence & Risk Verification sYstem) provides a comprehensive framework for evaluating health-information claims using evidence-based methodology. It implements a five-tier classification system (TEL-5: Gold, Silver, Bronze, Red, Black) with gate governance protocol (GGP) featuring safety-first monotonicity principles. The system combines REML + Monte Carlo meta-analysis with automated journal quality assessment and AI-powered literature review capabilities. This repository contains the complete implementation including 70+ real evidence entries, production-ready analysis pipeline, and patent-protected methodologies for reproducible evaluation of nutritional supplements and health interventions.
references: Kim, G. (2025). TERVYX Protocol v1.0: A Reproducible Governance & Labeling Standard for Health-Information Evidence. GitHub repository. https://github.com/moneypuzzler/tervyx
Korean Patent Application No. KR 10-2025-0143351: Verification of Non-scientific Health-Information Claims — GGP-based Hybrid Control
notes: This work includes patent-protected methodologies under Korean Patent Application KR 10-2025-0143351. The TERVYX Protocol represents a novel approach to automated evidence evaluation with safety-first principles and multi-gate quality control.
method: The TERVYX Protocol employs a five-tier evidence classification system (TEL-5) with Gate Governance Protocol (GGP) implementing Φ → R → J → K → L sequential evaluation. Meta-analysis uses REML estimation with Monte Carlo simulation (n=10,000 draws) to calculate P(effect > δ) probabilities. Safety-first monotonicity ensures that Φ-gate (physiological plausibility) or K-gate (safety) failures result in immediate BLACK classification regardless of other quality scores. The system integrates real-time literature search via PubMed E-utilities, AI-powered abstract analysis using Gemini API, comprehensive journal quality assessment, and automated evidence synthesis.

patent_info.title: Verification of Non-scientific Health-Information Claims — GGP-based Hybrid Control
